Ingredients.1: 4 pounds beef soup bones (shank and knee)

Ingredients.2: 1 medium onion, unpeeled and cut in half

Ingredients.9: 0.5 pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Directions.2: Place beef bones on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven until browned, about 1 hour.

Directions.3: Place onion halves on a second baking sheet and roast on another rack until blackened and soft, about 45 minutes.

Directions.4: Transfer beef bones and onion halves to a large stockpot. Add ginger, salt, star anise, fish sauce, and 4 quarts water; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 6 to 10 hours. Strain the broth into a saucepan and set aside.

Directions.5: Place rice noodles in a large bowl filled with room temperature water. Let soak for 1 hour. Drain.

Directions.6: When noodles have soaked for 1 hour, heat up the reserved broth by bringing it to a simmer.

Directions.7: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the noodles in the boiling water for 1 minute. Drain.

Directions.8: Divide noodles among 4 serving bowls; top with sirloin, cilantro, and green onion. Ladle hot broth over the top. Stir and let sit until beef is partially cooked and no longer pink, 1 to 2 minutes.

Directions.9: Serve with bean sprouts, Thai basil, lime wedges, hoisin sauce, and chile-garlic sauce on the side.
